intro: Marsdenia guanchezii, commonly known as the Canary Islands Marsdenia, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in coastal and rocky habitats, often growing in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
